programme.title: The Edge
programme.desc: Follow people pushing boundaries using new ways of doing things..

programme.title: State of the Union
programme.desc: Euronews' State of the Union brings you up to date with the most important european affairs, politics, economic, financial and corporate events of the week.

programme.title: State of the Union
programme.desc: Euronews' State of the Union brings you up to date with the most important european affairs, politics, economic, financial and corporate events of the week.

programme.title: FYI Extra
programme.desc: Short bulletin rounding up the day's showbusiness stories.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley follows the Silk Road from the Black Sea to the Caspian Sea, travelling across the post-Soviet states of Georgia and Azerbaijan. From the seaside resort of Batumi, on Georgia's Black Sea, Joanna travels across the heart of the Caucasus region, passing through stunning mountain settlements, cities and vineyards, and finally the uber-modern city of Baku, the capital of oil-rich Azerbaijan. On the way she learns not only about the ancient Silk Road, but how these two very different countries are still finding their identities.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: London-based couple Ben and Oliver, expectant parents Katie and Ant from Essex, and husband and wife duo Tina and Des from Somerset try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray.

programme.title: Christmas Is Magic!
programme.desc: Once again the famous Magic Christmas provides the soundtrack to your seasonal celebrations. We'll be playing all your festive favourites until you've finished your final turkey sandwich.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let Kiss keep you up all night with the finest collection of RandB tunes and nocturnal beats.

programme.title: News, Sport, Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news and sports headlines, plus weather forecasts.

programme.title: Collapse: Retreat from Afghanistan
programme.desc: Sky News Chief Correspondent Stuart Ramsay bears witness to the panicked scrambles at Kabul Airport as troops make their final exit from Afghanistan, 20 years after 9/11.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: The Real Chernobyl
programme.desc: After the success of the Sky Atlantic drama series we travel to Ukraine to meet some of the people who were actually involved in dealing with the Chernobyl nuclear disaster in 1986.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A labyrinth of tunnels underneath a tiny French village which contains mysteries from several historical eras, and a Welsh slate mine that has been given a new lease of life.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Constructing the Gotthard Base Tunnel in Switzerland, the longest rail tunnel in the world, running for 57 kilometres through the Alps.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The spacecraft designed for the first manned mission to Mars, planned to launch by 2035, which requires the most powerful rocket ever built and a specially designed crew module.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Help! My House Is Haunted
programme.desc: The team is called in to investigate a 17th-century pub, where the landlord is petrified to enter the attic as he believes a sinister spirit resides there.

programme.title: Hotel Paranormal
programme.desc: A security guard encounters a well-dressed spirit at an upmarket hotel in California, while a young girl watches a shadow man emerge from the walls of her hotel suite.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple from Durham want to find a holiday home that they can also let out for part of the year. With a budget of £120,000, they search for a property in Frigiliana.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: A retired couple from Devon want a slice of the traditional Spanish lifestyle in Almeria. Property expert Ben Hillman helps them hunt for a dream home.

programme.title: Question Team
programme.desc: On the panel for this edition are Sara Pascoe, Darren Harriott, Jessica Knappett, and special guest Isy Suttie.

programme.title: This Country
programme.desc: Daisy May and Charlie Cooper's spoof documentary presents a wry look at the lives of young people living in modern, rural Britain. Taking up residence in a small village in the Cotswolds, a camera crew details the everyday experiences of ne'er-do-well cousins Kerry and Lee 'Kurtan' Mucklowe. The series begins as Kurtan turns his attention to winning a local scarecrow-making contest.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster pose ridiculous Hypothetical scenarios to Richard Ayoade, Ivo Graham, Evelyn Mok and Roisin Conaty.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: When Old Man Winter blasts into Labrador without warning, a nearby Nordic Ski Club needs to get their rescue sled operational in a hurry.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Deep
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade explores a new theory that could explain the mystery surrounding what happens in an infamous stretch of water.

programme.title: Ed Stafford: First Man Out
programme.desc: Ed challenges Matt 'The Juggernaut' Wright, in the Wanshan Archipelago off the coast of southern China. They race to build rafts as storms roar in.

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier
programme.desc: The desperate hunt for food continues in the Alaskan wilderness while Dan's health takes a downward spiral and the group endure their worst shelter yet.

programme.title: Bear Grylls: Born Survivor
programme.desc: Former Special Forces adventurer Bear Grylls is propelled into the dense jungles of Borneo, where he investigates the best way to escape the complex terrain.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: The brothers-in-law team up with a company to build a one-of-a-kind table tank for a Las Vegas trade show. Later, they create a replica crabbing boat aquarium.

programme.title: Barnwood Builders
programme.desc: The team helps a widower build the antique log cabin that him and his late wife had always dreamed of creating together in Lake Hartwell, Georgia..

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The Salvage Dawgs save a calliope from a riverboat in Parkersburg, West Virginia. Courtney collaborates with Mike to build a mirror from pieces of wall trim at the shop.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: As Australia prepares for a lockdown because of Covid-19, Steve Grahame races to beat a border shutdown. Plus, a driver battles through bush fires to get to desperate farmers.

programme.title: UCI Track Champions League
programme.desc: Action from round four at Lee Valley VeloPark in London.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Documentary considering the challenges that faced constructors of Crystal Serenity, a ship that is consistently voted the world's best cruise liner.

programme.title: Nick Knowles Heritage Rescue
programme.desc: Eastnor Castle is a Grade I listed building in the beautiful setting of the Malvern Hills. Can a team rescue its ornate bridge and two priceless ceilings?.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Exploring the construction and inner workings of the Robert E Peary, an American military supply ship.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items go under the microscope, as the processes behind objects including reconditioned sander drums and lithographs are explained.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items go under the microscope, with this edition explaining how objects including calissons and diving watercrafts are made.

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Beets Cafe, Austin, Texas, asks the team for help when she fears that her employees are selling the secret recipes to her raw food menu.

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After Paul, owner of Nacho Daddy in Las Vegas, notices a problem with the expensive scorpions used in his restaurant's 'scorpion shot', he contacts Charles to investigate.

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert Irvine comes to the rescue of a grill in Alexandria, Virginia. The restaurant is in a good location and the owners work hard, so why is it failing?.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: The chef gets down to basics by demonstrating how to make simple, accessible and modern recipes. The first episode sees Gordon reveal the secret of cooking with confidence, dishing up pork chops with sweet and sour peppers, and pan-fried scallops with a crunchy apple salad. He also offers tips for the kitchen, including how to keep knives sharp.

programme.title: Redacted Tonight

programme.title: Keiser Report
programme.desc: A no-holds-barred look at the shocking scandals behind the global financial headlines. With the help of Keiser's co-host, Stacy Herbert, and guests from around the world, 'Keiser Report' tells you what is really going on in the global economy.

programme.title: Worlds Apart with Oksana Boyko
programme.desc: Worlds Apart is a fast-paced, in-depth discussion on the pressing issues of the day. The host Oksana Boyko strives to depart from the traditional Q-and-A form of interview in favor of an emotive and engaging conversation. While the title and format of the program presuppose differences of opinion, WA's main goal is to facilitate public debate in an intelligent and respectful manner.

programme.title: Sputnik Orbiting The World
programme.desc: Looking behind the stories which made the news, as well as unearthing the ones that didn't.

programme.title: RT Documentaries
programme.desc: Featuring different aspects of life, ranging from news-related events and politics to historical heritage, culture, traditions, cuisine, wildlife, travel.

programme.title: News Weekly
programme.desc: The week's most important news review.

programme.title: RT Documentaries
programme.desc: Featuring different aspects of life, ranging from news-related events and politics to historical heritage, culture, traditions, cuisine, wildlife, travel.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Barrister James Kavanagh (John Thaw) tries to clear an Oxbridge undergraduate accused of raping a housewife, but his home life begins to interfere with work and the cracks in his marriage to independent and successful wife Lizzie re-emerge. First episode of the legal drama, guest starring Ewan McGregor, with Alison Steadman, Lisa Harrow and Anna Chancellor.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The mysterious symbol of the keyhole exists in mystic texts, sacred architecture and ancient artwork found all over the planet. This programme tries to determine whether there more to it than meets the eye.

programme.title: National Park Mysteries
programme.desc: A plane crash in the Everglades National Park leads to strange hauntings - and some believe the park may exert a dark, transformative power.

programme.title: National Park Mysteries
programme.desc: The Hawaii Volcanoes National Park is the site of strange events said to be linked to the legendary Native Hawaiian Goddess of the Volcano, Pele.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator's search for people with superhuman skills and powers leads him to a blind man who claims he can see with his mind.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes in the courtroom when a gun ends up in the wrong hands. Meanwhile, a defendant turns on his attorney in a brutal attack, and someone bares all for the judge.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: A judge is threatened by a murder suspect. Meanwhile, there's a savage attack in the courtroom when two sons see red as their mother's killer is sentenced.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a 160-year-old Tiffany watch, which has no identifying markings other than the name on its face. The pressing question is how the company verify that it is genuine.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold begins to fall, and the staff worry that they could end up losing money. Les, Seth and Ashley become more conscious of what items they buy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les offers to buy a diamond-encrusted watch from a customer. He makes sure his jewellery expert takes a close look, having been stung by a similar deal previously.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold continues to drop. Seth suggests they should review their purchases, and sort out the cluttered sales floor, along with a warehouse overloaded with junk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is angered when Les dismisses the consultant's suggestions about improving business practices. Seth disappears, and his manager fears he may be on the verge of quitting.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How killers who poison their victims rely on their targets' trust to commit their crimes, and why they sometimes murder more than once.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Andrew Nesbitt, found dead on his 46th birthday in his Wisconsin apartment after a night out. Officers sought clues from CCTV in local bars, cabs and street corners.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 17-year-old Bridgett Frisbie, who was lured to woodland near her Texas home town in April 2011 and shot dead. Her friend Alex Olivieri killed the teenager to prevent her revealing her knowledge of an earlier crime in which he was involved.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: An investigation into a US bank robbery in 1997, during which two armed men opened fire on staff and police officers at close range.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Neglected parrots are rescued from an abandoned house, and a trapped cat is helped out of a tight spot. Plus, advice on tackling a wild raccoon.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: The work of Houston vets Dr Blue, Dr Ross and Dr Lavigne, who have their hands full with everything from risky surgeries to diagnosing sick chameleons.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Australia
programme.sub-title: It Takes a Village to Buy a Dress
programme.desc: A bride finds dress shopping a more emotional experience than expected, and a customer may have finally made her choice after trying on 60 gowns.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: When Darren and Elizabeth marry two months after meeting, no one thinks it's a good idea, and when one is attacked, people's fear may have been proven right.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: When Rebecca joins trucker Lee Michael on the road, adventure and love awaits, but trouble ensues when they open their relationship up to others.
